1153.title: Even More Original Characters

14.content: Some recent (and not so recent) anime for the choosing.
14.title: Anime to choose from

141.content: Perhaps Ibuki's already great curves will get even better? Or perhaps Ayane will finally get herself a chest that would dwarf even her elder sister's?
141.title: Asu no Yoichi: Ibuki or Ayane?

1412.content: So what will happen to young Ayane?
1412.title: Ayane: what kind of process?

choices: A girl she wasn't familiar with
14122.content:
For all her life Ayane had been compared to her older sister Ibuki, which left the 16 year-old blond forever frustrated. Whether it was in academics, sports, or even simply helping around the house, her older sister seemed to be better in every way, making her accomplishments seem futile. It didn't help that Ibuki was admired for her beauty, long hair, and ample chest, whereas the short-haired, flat-chested Ayane was all but ignored. Typically she tried to ignore or ride off her inferiority complex when it came to her sister, but today seemed a little..different.

It began when Ayane walked to class and saw several students in her class admiring Ibuki as she walked down the hallway.

"Your sister is really something!" commented one student.

"Yeah! She's pretty, smart, and kind. Sometimes I forget you two are related."

"Hey, would you hook me up with her sometime on a date?"

This drove Ayane nuts today for some reason. But more than that..she felt like her classmates had gotten taller. Feeling like she was going to puke, Ayane ran out of the hallway and bumped into another of her teachers.

"Ayane!" her math teacher yelled, who was an adult woman in her early 30s with short, brown hair and green eyes.. "Look at this grade!"

The teacher flashed in front of her a 48, slightly below the failing mark.

"Why can't you be more like your sister, Ibuki? She was a wonderful student when I had her last year."

Ayane felt weird again as she felt everything around her growing in size. She used to be about level with her math teacher, but she was several inches shorter than her.

"But..But..I.." Ayane tried to say, but she was interrupted again.

"'But' nothing! If you don't clean up your act, you're going to be here come summer for extra classes! *Sigh* I wish you were like Ibuki.."

Ayane felt another tingling once more, her teacher growing ever taller in front of her.

"..she was kind, smart, and attentive. She was the best student I ever had."

Ayane decided to run away from her teacher, who now had to at least a foot taller than her now. The frustrated girl ran into the nearest girls' bathroom and sat in one of the stalls.

"What is happening to me?!" the worried blond cried on the can. "It's like I get smaller every time I'm compared to my sister!"

Ayane was right; she was shrinking. Every time Ibuki was complimented or she was put down in comparison to her, she shrunk. The formerly 5'1" high school girl was now barely 3'10". Her clothes kept up with her shrinking, but for how long? Things didn't help when a couple of girls started talking about Ibuki in the bathroom, where they pointed out what a great job she did recently with passing out fliers around the school.

"Did you notice that Ibuki-san's sister seemed..unenthusiastic?" one girl noted.

"Yeah. She seemed like she didn't care. I wish she was more like her sister", her friend replied.

Ayane shrunk again in response to this, now down to 3'4".

"Even her younger sisters try harder. Chihaya writes stories, and Kagome is actually pretty smart, as well as a good cook."

Ayane felt the world growing around her some more as she shrunk to 2'11", looking more depressed than ever.

"But Ayane..I dunno. She seems..plain."

"And anti-social. No wonder guys don't talk to her."

"Not to mention she has the physique of a grade school girl."

Barely 2 feet tall now, Ayane waited for the girls to leave before she crawled around the stall of the bathroom to leave. Now the bathroom looked so large to her now! The toilet she was on before looked like something more out of a water park, and the bathroom door itself looked like the gates of a castle.

"What is going on?!" Ayane screamed in a higher-pitched voice than usual as she tried to reach the bathroom door, but to no avail. She decided to hide behind the sink until someone else came in, allowing her a chance to leave. But who would it be?
14122.title: Literal belittlement

141221.content:
The girl who entered the bathroom was none other than her older sister Ibuki! The cheerful older sister of hers quickly ran to a stall and did her business. during this time Ayane froze like a statue, hoping not to make any noise as she waited for her to come and leave so that she could exit the bathroom. It ended being a lot longer a wait than she thought, though..

At the end it took 10 minutes for Ibuki to finish her business in the bathroom, washing her hands in the sink after she was done. The girl then turned around and headed out the bathroom door, with Ayane quickly running behind her as she walked her way out of there. Prompting the door with her arms, the short blonde barely maid it out; any slower and she would've gotten crushed by the door's weight.

When she got outside, she was greeted by Ibuki's colossal figure, as well as some of her friends. An embarrassed but happy Ibuki was complemented by her friends as they walked down the hall and to the next class, making Ayane feel belittled once more..as well as shrink her to 1'8".

"Damn it, I'm going to keep shrinking into oblivion at this rate!" the enraged blonde yelled, her voice barely audible in the loud hallway. Noticing the flood of students heading to class, Ayane had to be extremely careful of where she walked as she headed to her next class, pretending like someone would notice her as she walked to it. She found herself running for long stretches at a time simply to keep up with the other students. When she finally made it to her class she was wiped out, sweat coming down her face like it was its own fountain.

"Hey, where's Ayane?" one girl asked her friend right outside the classroom door. "She was supposed to be here today."

"I guess she left, or didn't tell us. I wish she was more reliable", her friend replied.

Ayane felt that horrible feeling again just then of feeling inferior to her sister Ibuki, now barely squeaking by at 1'5".

I'm my own person! she cried to herself. Stop comparing me to my older sister!!

Ayane continued to cry as her height dwindled down even further to 1'2", which she would've noticed had she not still been crying. Too upset to think straight, Ayane ran away from her scheduled and (hopefully to her) the school as well. Unfortunately, she was stopped by..
141221.title: Ayane's big sister gets bigger!

14123.content: One last question; what kind of expansion are we looking at here?
14123.title: Ayane: expansion options

1413.content: The younger sisters of the family are a little short for their age. Perhaps we can fix that, or will they grow somewhere else?
1413.title: Asu no Yoichi: Chihaya or Kagome?

14131.content: Chihaya's used to writing manga based on her sisters and Yoichi. Perhaps, though, a more interesting story will be made featuring Chihaya herself..
14131.title: Chihaya: what kind of process?

choices: Expansion will be in a specific place
141312.content: Will the expansion be in a specific place, or just happen at random to any part of her body?
141312.title: Chihaya expansion choices

1413122.content: One last question; will Chihaya's spurts be of her shrinking or growing?
1413122.title: Chihaya: uneven shrink or growth?

choices: Chihaya takes a break, unaware of her uneven growing yet
14131222.content:
It was an ordinary day for young Chihaya as she drew her manga for the school paper. It was very quiet too, which it seldom was ever since Yoichi moved in to her home a month ago. At first her sisters had a hard time accepting him, but now he feels like part of the family. His actions also inspired Chihaya to write more interesting stories than ever before. Her most interesting story yet, though, was about to happen just then..

As Chihaya began the inking process of her manga, she felt her inking hand getting bigger and bigger, her pen looking smaller in comparison. Soon enough she accidentally stroke a line clear across the page, smudging it in black ink. Further analysis revealed that her hand was twice the size it usually was. Did it get swollen?

"What the heck?" Chihaya replied with a little bit of worry, wondering how she got such a swollen hand. "Maybe I should spray this room with bug spray more often.."

Chihaya slowly continued her work, not knowing that her other hand had grown twice in size just then as well..
14131222.title: Chihaya's "growing" story

14132.content: Five years after the start of Asu no Yoichi, little Kagome has blossomed into a pretty 14 year old girl, with long, dark purple hair and a perky chest. But what further changes will await that will make even puberty look insignificant?
14132.title: Kagome: what kind of process?

141321.content: Will Kagome grow to be the tallest of her sisters, or shrink down so small to the point where even her original height at 9 years of age will look massive?
141321.title: Kagome: giantess, or shrunken?

142.content: Love Hina has quite a cast of females to choose from. Let's start with two of the bigger (heh) girls in the series.
142.title: Love Hina: Naru, Mutsumi, or...?

1451.content: Which ninja girl would you like to focus on?
1451.title: Naruto Shippuden

14511.content:
"I...I..."
"W-what's wrong, Hinata? Something gettin' you down?"

It was a calm, cool, cloudless afternoon. Hinata had been offered a meal at the Ichiraku Ramen Shop by Naruto. Ever since they were young, Hinata had always had a crush on him, but couldn't explain to herself why her passion for him kept growing stronger every time she laid eyes on him. And nearly every time they bumped into each other, she would become quiet, shy, and lost for words. Her face would turn red in slight embarrassment, almost too scared to even speak. Over time, though, she had become braver and more open, which, to her, is a big improvement in her personality.

Today, however, was a little different. Earlier on in the week, she had been attacked and abducted by a rogue ninja, completely without warning. She was fortunate, though, because Jaraiya, one of three legendary sannin, had very quickly caught wind of it. Naruto was then informed, who soon after took off on the rescue mission. Since he had been out for the past three years training with Jaraiya, he knew that he was ready to yet again put his life on the line for a comrade.

Since the rescue was a success, Hinata wanted to pay him back in some way. Sadly, she was unable to think of anything; she was having difficulty looking into his eyes, ears reddening. She was, thankfully, able to bring up some words describing how she feels about him.

"Naruto... I... wanted to thank you... for saving me... from that ninja." These words were difficult to get out.

"Hey, don't sweat it." he replied. "It was nothing, really. The guy barely stood a chance!"

Hinata knew this to be a brag: In truth, the kidnapper held up well against the orange ninja.

She didn't really mind, though. All she cared about was rewarding the one guy that really cared about her. She blushed again, her mind focused strongly on him. She swallowed another spoonful of ramen, the noodles warming her as they slithered down her throat into her stomach. The flavor that hit her was, oh, so divine. She turned to look at him. and again felt a warm feeling. She wanted to be with him for the rest of her life; for the rest of both their lives. What really got her down was the fact that neither of her parents would allow it until she was of age.

After the meal, Naruto tipped the owner, thanked him for the ramen (as usual), and told Hinata that he would escort her home.

"Why would you... want to do that?" she asked him, a slightly unnerving look appearing on her face.

"Well, ya' never know: There might be other kidnappers out there." Naruto told her in his calmest voice. "Besides, I don't want anything bad happening to you. No one does. Got to keep a sharp mind."

Hinata flushed with emotion. Hearing her crush say something like this always made her happy... the happiest she ever felt.
14511.title: Hinata

145112.content:
It was midday in the Leaf Village, the sun beaming through the calm, motionless trees in the spring air. Two ninjas were on a short trip to a small part of the village that many have visited.

There, standing on one side of street stood a small stand, the salesman looking lively.

Curiosity struck Hinata and Naruto as they passed the portly peddlar, who shouted "Make all your dreams come true! No charge what-so-ever!"

"N-Naruto. Why don't we stop and ask what he's selling.?"

"Huh?" Naruto was confused: He couldn't remember the last time Hinata had done that.

"I want to see what we can by! Is that okay?"

Naruto eyed the man suspiciously: To him, it probably wasn't a good idea. Free whatevers with no hidden charge? Not having to pay even a dime for them? This kind of thing does cause suspicion, and Naruto was in the right.

"Maybe just real quick," he ushered. "I'm not too sure about him."

With caution, they approached the stand, Hinata eager to see what was on sale.

The joyous peddlar looked down at his most customers. "Well, hello there, young travelers! What would you like?"

He seemed friendly enough, but his collection of items and knick-knacks was incredibly bizaar: There were charm bracelets, lamps, exotic jewelry, even a few dream-catchers.

Very bizaar, indeed.

"What are these?" Naruto asked, pointing at what looked like a couple of jewelry boxes.

"Oh, these?" the peddlar said. "These are wishing chests. They are proven to make your wishes come alive!"

"Oh, that sounds wonderful!" Hinata squealed. "How do they work?" She was eager to know.

"All you have to do," the peddlar stated, sounding informative, "is take a small piece of paper, write your wish on it, whatever that wish may be, put that wish into the box, and the very next day, that wish will be granted! I've used it myself."

Naruto looked sly. "Riiigght. I'll take your word for it."

"Oh, please, Naruto?" She wanted one.

Normally, Naruto would refuse a request, but this was Hinata. "Alright, old man." he said. "I'll take one."

"How delightful!" the peddlar cheered. He handed one of the boxes to Naruto, who grudgingly accepted it.

"Please come again!" the paddlar saluted.

"Will do, old man." Naruto said sarcasticly. He turned to Hinata. "Man, I'd thought we'd never leave!"

"Oh, come on. Don't be like that." Hinata said. She was starting to sound like Sakura.

"Sorry, Hinata. I'm just not used to that used to wierd people that just pop up out of nowhere. Now, let's get you home."

"Right!" Hinata said.
145112.title: What's That?

14512.content:
Sakura was on her way to the forest of death to get in some early morning training. She was always quick-witted, and this morning's training session was going to be exceptionally interesting. She laughed to herself, picturing in her mind what was to come later on.

Making her way into the forest, she unexpectedly came across a peculiar little item lying in the grass. It looked to be some sort of awkward looking accessory, no bigger than a bracelet. It was shaded a light golden hue, glimmering in the sun. Curiously, she picked it up, brought it close to her eyes, and examined it.

'What is this thing?' she thought to herself. She turned the newly discovered object over. On the back of it was a very strange looking symbol.

'This sign... I've seen it before. I know it.'

Suddenly, she heard a noise from behind her. She quickly turned around to see what or who it was, making sure not to drop the golden trinket. Fortunately, it was only a raccoon.

Drawing her attention back to the mysterious little item in her hand, she thought to herself, 'where have I seen this sign before?' As she finished her thought, the object started to glow, emitting a bright blue light that almost blinded her. She had to cover her flawless face to keep it from getting distorted.

Then, almost as quickly as the light had appeared, it dissipated, leaving Sakura in a state of confusion. 'What was that all about?' she thought.

Just then, without warning, Tsunade appeared in tree to her right; Shizune in one to her left.
14512.title: Sakura

145121.content:
"You're late!" Tsunade ushered.

Surprised to see that they had appeared so suddenly, Sakura quickly pocketed the seemingly alien item, being especially careful to let neither the hokage nor her assistant take notice.

"Sorry to keep you waiting, Lady Tsunade," Sakura responded. Her arms quivered slightly.

"This is unusual," Shizune interjected, "even for you, Sakura. You've never been late to anything before, not even a mission." Shizune couldn't help but wonder.

"Well then," the hokage announced in a powerful voice, "shall we get started?"

Being the type of girl who would want to be able to defend herself in case of attack (though she was already good at it), she knew she had to get stronger, not only for this reason, but also to bring Sasuke back. Of course she knew that Naruto would want to help her with this since Naruto apparently liked her. Still, she was somewhat fond of the thought.

She focused her energy into her arms, reaching for a kunai in her utility pack. "I'm ready to begin!" she stated boldly, arm at shoulder hight and bent inward, kunai in hand. She threw her entire body into a fighting stance, readying herself for first strike.

Tsunade and Shizune both prepared themselves in the same manner as Sakura had. As they did so, Sakura leapt out of view, as they had anticipated would be her first move. Instinctively, they responded by chasing after their pupil, not to harm, but to toughen up.

All three of them were high in the air, Sakura ahead by about twenty or thirty feet. This was normal for her; she done this many times in past sessions. She looked behind her to see that her trainers were closely tailing her. Higher and higher they flew until they hit around 150, at which point gravity began taking over. As Sakura peaked in her climb, she quickly spun in mid-air and, without hesitation, launched several shuriken at her pursuers, who immediately dodged the attack.

Within a split of landing feet first back on the ground, Sakura took no chances by just staying there in that spot; she needed to take cover. She headed deeper into the forest, to hide in the trees. She had the intention of preparing a trap for her adversaries. Once she found a good hiding spot, she went over her options, deciding what to do next.

No sooner had she hid did Tsunade and Shizune arrive roughly where she was. In previous hiding attempts, they had always been able to find her right then and there. This time, she was in luck: Judging by how they were pivoting their heads, Sakura came to the conclusion that they had no idea where she was. Regardless of this, she did not drop her guard in case they decided to begin searching. Wary of this, she waited a while, prepared to make her next move.
145121.title: Let's Begin

1451211.content:
Patiently, Sakura waited for her chance while simultaneously going over options. Naturally, most, if not all of them, would have consequences.

She could just do the rookie mistake and pop up out of the bush and attack head-on. The benefit is that they would be caught by surprise. The downside was that, since they were more experienced (Tsunade especially), they would quickly retaliate, interrupting her attack and pinning her to the ground.

Her second option would be to quickly, but quietly, walk in a circle and come from behind. This, however, also had a critical error, because they would suspect it.

The third choice involved creating clones of herself and then strike at them, but this would create a slight problem: The bush was big enough to hold at least four other people, but just barely, and Sakura needed at least six copies of herself, and that would give her away.

But then, all of a sudden, a thought crossed her mind: What if she a combination of all three? That would definitely seem to work. Well, in theory, anyway, but it was the only thing she could do without losing. Pondering the thought for a few moments she decided to go for it.

To put her plan into action, she quickly threw a few shuriken in their direction, and as expected, they had dodged. Immediately after throwing the shuriken, she created a clone of herself, which, upon appearing, shot out of the bush and into the air, quickly drawing Tsunade's and Shizune's attention, who soared after the clone. Once she had the opportunity, the real Sakura quickly moved to the other side behind Tsunade and Shizune, quickly conjuring up more clones the second she had enter the larger bush. No sooner had this happened had the clone in the air been defeated, disappearing from view in a puff of smoke. Sakura waited until Shizune and Tsunade were both back on the ground, at which time she and her clones flew out of the bush, one by on, in quick succession. Realizing that she had to act fast, she and her clones reached for their belts and pulled out kunai and shuriken, accurately aiming them at the sleeves of her teachers, who had just realized that they had been fooled. They quickly turn around, but it was already too late: The shuriken and kunai had grabbed their sleeves and pinned them to the trunk of a large tree.

They had lost.
1451211.title: Strike

14512111.content:
Sakura landed on the ground, impressed by how well the tactic worked and how quickly she had executed it. In fact, she was amazed by it; she couldn't even remember the last time she had reflexes that swift or timing that precise. It had astonished her, and by judging the look on Tsunade's and Shizune's faces, they were also stunned. They couldn't believe it; they had been sacked by a chunin!

The Sakura clones disappeared from view while the real Sakura walked toward them. "So," she said, her voice between bragging and seductive. "What do you think of that?"

Shizune opened her mouth to speak, but no words came out, still stunned by how quickly she was beaten by a ninja less experienced the she was. Tsunade, on the other hand, had no problem getting words out.

"Well," she began, as the clone shuriken and kunai vanished, allowing her and Shizune to pry the remaining ones from the tree, freeing themselves in the process. "I don't think I have ever seen such technique before. There's no telling where or how you came up with that little maneuver, but it was effective and well planned out, and I, for one, am amazed at how fluidly you pulled it off.

"You're definitely showing signs of improvement, and that's exactly what I wanted to see. It's that kind of quick wit that will give you the edge, and even a slight advantage can have adverse effect. Well done."

"Thank you, Lady Tsunade," Sakura responded, knowing that she had finally surpassed her advisor.

"That will be all for today," Tsunade finished. "*Yawn* Boy, am I tired. I'll head back to the mansion to catch a few Z's. I expect to see even better results in the next session."

Upon stating these words, Tsunade and Shizune shot out of view.

Seeing as it was almost 9:00, according to the position of the sun, Sakura decided to head home as well.

Still, something was bugging her: How was she able to pull off such an advanced tactic without even slipping up? You'd have to be a high-level ninja to pull it off, and even then it would take dozens of attempts just to get it right. Yet Sakura was able to do it in one go, without any hesitation, and she was still only a chunin. It just didn't seem to make sense. It was mind-boggling.

Coming to the conclusion that it was pure, blind luck, she shook her head, erasing from her mind what had just happened. Maybe it'll all be clear after a few dumplings at Amaguriama.

******

Within the shadows of the forest, a mysterious figure appears from the bushes. 'Perfect. Just as expected.' He said in a low, even voice.

"What's the status?" Another figure had appeared out of the bushes, but the far side of the forest.

"Everything's going to plan." The first figure answered. "The fish has been hooked."

"Excellent." said the second figure, a grin forming on his face. "Phase one complete. It's now almost time for phase two."

"But we need to be cautious. The Hidden Leaf's ninja are very strong. If anyone discovers us, and our plans, we're screwed."

"And that's why the boss specifically hired us for the job, because we're the least likely to screw up."

"Don't get too full yourself. We still need to proceed with caution."

"Don't worry. The plan will go without a hitch as long as we're the ones pulling it off."
14512111.title: Congratulations

choices: A Moment Interrupted! Ino Enters The Emotion
145121111.content:
10:30

Walking around the village seemed to bore Sakura for some reason. Usually, it would give her a reason to train even more, but, somehow, today was different. 'Maybe that move was a bit tricky to pull off, even if I did it in one go,' she thought to herself. She just couldn't seem to get that image out of her head. Why was it bothering her so much? What was the meaning of her day? And why was she still thinking about it?

"Hey, Sakura!"

Sakura jumped. Who could be sneaking up on her at a time like this? Then again, she never did like it when people snuck up on her. She turned around to see who it was, and, as always, it was Naruto. Why couldn't he just leave her alone?

"Ugh, what do you want?" she said in a sour tone.

"I just wanted to see how you were doing. You know, thoughts to yourself and all."

"I'm perfectly fine, thank you. Why do you still want to talk to me?"

"Oh, um..." Naruto wanted to tell the truth about how he felt towards her, but couldn't get the right words out.

"Well? I'm waiting." Sakura said, her foot tapping on the ground.

"I... just want to be with you, Sakura."

Sakura looked at him with a puzzled look on her face.

'Aaw, crap.' Naruto thought. 'NOW I've done it. She's gonna kill me!'

But instead of raising her fist to him, Sakura just smiled. "That's very sweet of you."

"Huh!?" Naruto was confused. "What do mean, Sakura?"

She blushed.

"So, you're not gonna pound me, or throw me to the ground, or drag me around the village by my hair until I scream 'I give'?"

"No, silly." she giggled. "No way."

"But that's what you usually do whenever I do or say something stupid in front of you."

"I know." She stepped closer to him. "But what you just said was not stupid at all."

Now, Naruto was blushing, tiny beads of sweat trickling down his head. Was she coming on to him?
145121111.title: A Normal Day

145121112.content:
Just as the two bandits were about to leave the forest, a third figure had appeared right them; unfortunately, for them, it was not one of their own.

"And just what do you think you're doing?"

They had been spotted by one of the top shinobi in Hidden Leaf: Kakashi Hatake. His presence had completely caught them off guard; they knew they were busted.

But these were no ordinary bandits: They, too, were ninjas.

"So," the first figure said. "You knew we were here the whole time. You're quite the clever one." He gave a small chuckle.

"I know what you're up to," Kakashi said. "You planted that little trinket in the hopes that someone would come around to collect it. Once they did, you performed a genjutsu that would allow you to gain control over your new guinea pig. Am I correct?"

The two mysterious ninja both looked at each other, knowing that their plans have been discovered. However, they did not seemed to be fazed by this.

"You're smarter than you look," said the second figure, with a tone in his voice that sounded very serious. "How did you know?"

"A good shinobi is always one step ahead of his enemy."

At that precise moment, a few more Leaf ninja appeared: Jaraiya, Sarutobi, Guy, Kurenai, and many others.

"What do you think, Kakashi?" Guy stated. "Shall I hit them with Primary Lotus? Or perhaps knock them out with Dynamic Entry?"

"Easy, Guy." Sarutobi interjected, before Kakashi could answer. "We don't know who these two are, or where they came from. We can't just deliberately attack them."

"He's right," Kakashi said. "We don't want to start a fight that we might not win." His Sharingan eye pulsed.

"So, you want answers, huh?" The first figure said. "Well, we're not talking!"

"...Looks like their not giving us much of a choice," Kurenai said. "Guess we'll have to fight."

"Now, hold on!" Jaraiya said. "Didn't you hear Kakashi just now? We don't want to rush into things: We could easily be taken out that way. It's the first rule of being a ninja."

Kurenai stared at him, a dark sort of look in her eyes.

"But if you're right, and we have no choice but to use force, then we'll have to use caution. We can't go underestimating our opponents."

"If you're done yakking," the second figure said, "then what do you say we get this started?"
145121112.title: Divulgeance

choices: Is It Me Or The Trinket? The Truth of it All!
1451211122.content:
The bandits shot out of sight into the denser regions of the forest in an attempt to lure their pursuers into a trap, knowing that it might not work, for they themselves were slightly out of league. They did not, however, show fear or lack of judgement.

"Why are we running!?" the second figure questioned. "We could easily take them out!"

"Not all at once, Uryu." the first figure answered. "We're greatly outnumbered and outranked, and these shinobi know it. That's why we need to set a trap for them, so that we won't be incarcerated. Otherwise, it's child's play for them, and our leader would not appreciate that."

"Well, what do you suggest, Renji? That we hide and ambush?"

"Only partially." Renji stated. "We'll need to separate in order to do so. Then we can use the Impersonation Jutsu to defeat them."

"I love it!" Uryu said enviously. "Let's do it!"

"But we'll also need to focus on the girl, as well."

"Why do I get the feeling that you're planning something for yourself?"
1451211122.title: After Them!

choices: Repeating History: The Flight of Sakura Haruno
14512111221.content:
"What do you want, Naruto?" Once again, Sakura was being pestered by the most infamous ninja in the Leaf Village.

"I was just wondering if you wanted to train with me." Naruto said, hopefulness in his eyes.

"Sorry," Sakura said, "but I had finished training with Lady Tsunade earlier."

"Oh," Naruto said, head hanging low. "I understand." He was just about to walk off when Sakura said "But you won't how I won!"

These words caught the orange ninja's attention, who quickly stopped and turned on the spot. "How? How did you do it?"

"Well," Sakura started, as she went on to explain how she pulled off such impressive move. After her explanation, Naruto's mouth fell open.

"No way!! Are you serious!?" he asked in amazement.

"Mm-hmm. And I didn't even know I had done it until after Lady Tsunade and Shizune left. That's the really weird part."

"Whoa." Naruto said. Then, just as he was about to head for home, Sakura fell flat to the ground, her body jerking violently.

"Sakura!!"

She didn't respond.

"Oh, crap! What's going on?" Naruto had no idea what was happening as Sakura's twitching body continued to wriggle and writhe. "Help me... Naruto!" was all she could say before her body finally stopped flailing around.

*******

Sakura woke up in a daze, trying to remember what happened. 'Oh, my head' she said to herself as she slowly lifted her body into a sitting position. It took her a few moments to realize that she was in the medical center. Over to her left, she heard voices coming from beyond the door. She strained her ears, hoping to catch a few pieces of conversation.

"...If we hadn't gotten to her in time..."

"...that was a close call..."

"...something caused it to happen."

She then remembered the sharp pain that she had felt in her leg. 'It must've been from that trinket.' she thought to herself.
She had to have to have been right, she thought, yet she couldn't riddle out as to why. But then, at that very same moment, for some reason, she felt like going somewhere after she was released from the medical center. What a bizarre day indeed.
14512111221.title: RealizatIon! Sakura's Unfortunate Afternoon

choices: Abduction! Sakura's Desperate Cry For Help
14512112.content:
What an incredible move! Sakura was completely taken aback by what had just happened: A high-ranking move in just a few seconds? There was no way it could've been possible!

Despite Sakura's success, Tsunade and Shizune both were fierce shinobi. After 'sticking' to the tree to which they were pinned for just a few moments, they quickly disappeared from sight, leaving Sakura in the dirt to find them again.

But Sakura had anticipated that this would happen, as she was the smartest member of Team Kakashi. But intelligence often comes at a price: Although smart, she still wasn't fast enough to totally keep up with her tutors.

She did a quick scan around her, checking to see where Shizune and Tsunade were. After noting that they were nowhere to be found, she decided to do an overall search for them. But just as she had taken one step, she suddenly noticed a very thin wire just in front of her feet. She knew immediately that it was a trip wire, but she didn't know what kind of trap had been set. It was almost as if she was back at the training field doing that silly bell training with Kakashi and the others, although she wasn't the one that fell for just about every trick in the book. Regardless, she needed to be cautious; one wrong move could spring the trap, whatever it was. She then looked ahead of her and saw that there were wires criss-crossing each other in every direction: It was like a maze of string that seemed nearly impossible to navigate through.

At that moment, she felt a sort of tickling sensation on her upper-right thigh. But what could be causing it? Was it a bug? Or maybe that amulet! She pulled it out of her utility pack. This trinket was vibrating like crazy.She flipped it over in her hand. That symbol...

Without second thought, she raised the amulet above her head, eyes closed for some reason. She felt the gyrations of the amulet work their way down her arm, then up to her forehead. She then opened her eyes (although she didn't know why she had closed them in the first place) and saw a brand new sight.
14512112.title: Gotcha!

choices: Maybe A Little R&R For Now
145121121.content:
A foggy display appeared before her, yet she was standing completely still. At first she didn't know what was going on since she had never experienced anything like this before. Was it that she had just discovered a long forgotten jutsu? Or was it simply smoke and mirrors?

Evidently, it was neither, for she had just remembered talking to Neji at one point earlier on in the week, curious to know what it was like to wield the Byakugan.

"The Byakugan not only allows you to perform a variety of moves and jutsu," Neji explained to her, "it also doubles as a revealing jutsu that can be used to detect enemies coming from any direction."

"How does that work?" she asked.

"When performing this kind of jutsu, the Byakugan basically becomes a second pair of eyes with the zooming power of a telescope. If you're looking for a certain enemy, for example, you can essentially blur out any unwanted areas of the background just by using your mind, increasing your chances of finding that one shinobi."

Having remembered all this, Sakura did exactly what Neji had explained, keeping in mind that she could also zoom in from behind her. Sure enough, as told by Neji, she was able to find Tsunade and Shizune 30 feet up in a tree that was about 400 feet from her position to the right. It was the most amazing thing she had ever experienced, and she's not even related to the Hyuugas by blood.

Having scoped out her targets, she released the jutsu, placed the little trinket back inside her utility pack, then headed to her right. Now that she knew where Shizune and Tsunade were, she was sure to give them quite the surprise.
145121121.title: Byakugan Mode? Sakura's New Ability!

1451212.content:
'Heh,' Sakura said under her breath. 'They have no clue. Now's my chance.'

She prepared herself to attack her unsuspecting mentors, being careful not to make any audible noise.

"Wait. What's that?" Shizune said, looking in Sakura's direction. She saw a faint green light appear within the bushes, slowly gaining strength.

Sakura noticed it too, looking at the pocket that she had hidden the unknown trinket inside of, which glowed a brilliant green aura. Getting brighter and brighter, it began to blind Sakura, though she already had her arms over her eyes. The light grew in intensity, becoming even brighter than the blue light roughly five minutes prior.

"What the hell is going on!?" Tsunade screamed, apparently having taken notice to the ever strengthening glow, which by the time it had reached maximum luminosity, had covered half the forest.

******

"Hmm? What's that over there?" Kakashi asked Guy. They had looked over to the forest, from which the brilliant green light was originating.

"I'm not exactly sure, but I'm willing to bet that it has something to do with the Akatsuki!" Guy exclaimed. "Perhaps we should go over and investigate."

"Yes, perhaps we should." Kakashi stated calmly as ever. "Then again, the Akatsuki may not be behind it. There could be something else at work here. We can't just go jumping to conclusions. We're both too smart for that."

"Either way, we won't be able figure it out just by standing here!" No sooner had Guy finished that sentence than he was off to the forest of death.

'*Sigh*. He always does that.' Kakashi said to himself, following Guy to the forest.

******

"Make it stop!!" Sakura exclaimed. Her position within the bushes had already been given away by the glow from the object in her pocket that she had found earlier, so it didn't really matter. Still, she wished that it hadn't because just after she had screamed, the glow completely dissipated, which left her wide open. 'Great. I've been discovered.' She had to move fast, otherwise it was game over.

Fortunately, through experience, she decided that an effective method of escape was the using the clone jutsu to her advantage, which had helped her in the past. Without missing a beat, she put her hands together to form the classic ninja hand-sign. Not saying a word, she conjured up a solid clone of herself to replace herself. Doing this gave her enough time to find another hiding spot whereas her clone would quickly be defeated.

As she vacated the bush (being careful not to be seen), Shizune and Tsunade attacked the bush, throwing kunai and shuriken into it, which hit the clone. Vision still slightly blurred from the light, Sakura had noticed that they began searching for her yet again. The diversion had worked, and she was again out of sight, this time hanging out inside a small cavern.
1451212.title: Come To The Light

info.brief_description: Make any girl any size you want, bigger, smaller, any part(s)!
info.description:
In this universe, it's not too improbable for young women or anyone else to suddenly start expanding, shrinking, or anything else. The only restrictions to these stories:

- Characters that are altered must be female only.
- They must be 14+ years old.
- Please make chapters legible and at least three lines long.
- Don't end stories unless it's a line of chapters you've been working on. Please respect other people's work!
- Any size, any speed, even strange eroticism is allowed (herm, multiple appendages, etc.), but if you add the extra stuff, please include a "Something else"-esque option so anybody who wants to the continue the story another way is allowed to.
- Continuity!

Other than that, your main character can be anybody, the story focused around any kind of alteration. Just ALWAYS ALLOW FOR A SECONDARY OPTION!
Make up your own characters, use celebrities, models, anime characters or anyone you want!
